data.question: What is the empirical formula and formula weight for P11-Cu?
data.answer: Empirical formula: C109.59 H64 Cu9 N8 O35.85, Formula weight: 2638.23

data.question: What are the unit cell dimensions for P11-16/1?
How does the volume of P11 compare to P11-Cu?
data.answer: The volume of P11 is 3779.3(2) Å3 and the volume of P11-Cu is 4133.0(5) Å3.

data.question: What method was used for absorption correction in the crystal structure analysis of P11-Cu?
data.answer: Semi-empirical from equivalents method was used for absorption correction in the crystal structure analysis of P11-Cu.

data.question: Is the transformation of P11 to P11-Cu reversible according to AAS analysis after immersing P11-Cu back into Cd(NO3)2?
data.answer: The transformation of P11 to P11-Cu is not readily reversible, as AAS analysis after P11-Cu had been immersed in 0.05 M Cd(NO3)2 in MeOH for 10 days revealed that almost no Cu2+ was exchanged with Cd2+.

data.question: True or False: The crystal size of P11-16/1 is larger than that of P11-Cu.
What is the theta range for data collection for P11-8/1?
data.answer: The theta range for data collection for P11-8/1 is 2.19 to 54.38 degrees.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of P11 involves heating a mixture of Cd(NO3)2·4H2O, biphenyl-3,4′,5-tricarboxylate (H3BPT), and meso-tetra(N-methyl-4-pyridyl) porphine tetratosylate (TMPyP) at 85°C for 12 hours.
What is the main difference in the synthesis process between P11-4/1 and P11-8/1?
data.answer: The main difference in the synthesis process between P11-4/1 and P11-8/1 is the mole ratio of Cd(NO3)2 to Cu(NO3)2 used in the mixed MeOH solution in which the single crystals of porph@MOM-11 were immersed.

data.question: True or False: The UV-Vis spectra of P11 and its PSM derivatives in aqueous solution show that the encapsulated CdTMPyP cations were converted into CuTMPyP cations.
